body.p:
It is a long time since I wanted to write to
you, but circumstances of different nature prevented
me from doing so. Being in this City for the
purpose of buying goods for fall trade, I take to
day an hour to communicate with you.

I am sorry, that I never could have the
pleasure of having a personal acquaintance with you
but as the old saying is, by your works you shall
be known, namely being a reader of your Occident
for the last 4 years, I know you pretty near as well.
For my part I confess to you I take pride in being
a descendant of our comon grandfather Jacob, I feel
gratification in reading your Periodical, & the stand you
have taken in the defence of our holy Religion against
trespassers from amongst ourselves, & its columinators
from without. I admire your perseverance & eng energy
in pursuing your work for the welfare of Israel, & most
of all, the adherency to one & the same tendency of your
writings, the looking ahead to the one glorious end of
enlightening our brethren in the sublime system of the
Mosaic law & precepts, as handed down to us by our forefathers
it being our duty, to transmit the same to the next
generation unimpaired, not modelled, but remaining
the same, as the God who gave it, to the last end of time,

Being a German myself, I am sorry to
confess, that there is amongst that portion of Hebrew from
our Fatherland who are of the middle age very little
Intelligence or any wish at all to read a religious paper
or your work might have done more good already.

The younger portion, those from 18?—to 30
mostly think themselves Philosophers, every one thinks
himself a great man, what do we care about Religion
be a Gentleman, make money, & mockery at those
who hold fast to the tenents of our holy Law, most
of them ashamed to own themselves Jews, & here you
have got a Picture of the fathers of our next generation
to come. Our rich men, our men of Capital what
are they doing for the cause of Religion? They give
a 100 or so for to build a new Synagogue, another
100 towards benevolent purposes, & here is an end of it.

What will Judaism be in 50 years
in the great Republic, if the mind of those young
would be Philosophers, if the indifferentisness of our
rich men towards our holy law, if the unintelligence
of the masses of the Jews is not aroused, & the
question agitated, have we no other duty to perform
towards our almighty Father, but to pray on Hebrew
in the Synagogue, pay a few Dollars for maintaining
the Congregation & charitable Society, & then leave
the whole system to itself;—

Is the reform of our service in the Synagogue
all we can do, to transmit our holy Law to generations
to come? Is it not necessary first to impress each & every
one that the great gift of our heavenly Father the Hebrew
should be strictly kept? Shall we not have a Union
of all the Congregations of the U. S. to contribute all
for the erection of a Jewish University & seats of
learning, to educate ministers teachers & readers?
Should we not have a Jewish Hospital in the City
of N York, paid & kept by the Contributions of all the
Jews of the U. States? Could we not have Sabbath
shool Societies in each & ever congregation in the Land
as well as the Methodists? —

Those were some of my ideas, my friend, when
I took the pen to write to you, & I hope that you will
excuse a layman for meddling in religious concerns, which
belong more to the minister in the pulpit, but I could
not forbear to write them down, & let you peruse them.
Now to business of mine. Those Hebrew you once
wrote to me of having send the trough a house in this
city & another in Chicago, I never received, please
to inquire about them, or give me orders, where to make
inquiry here. I shall stay here about a fortnight longer
& be pleased to tell me, how much I Kohn & Bros
are in your debt for Occident, I have once remitted
to you = Ten Dollars. I shall afford me
pleasure to receive a line or two from you, meanwhile
I have the honor to remain respectfully A Kohn
from Chicago care of Schloss Heilbronn 47 Norfolk
str N. York
